bill_title: Honoring the 2002 Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team and the students and staff involved in the football program.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the 2002 Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team and the students and staff involved in the football program. WHEREAS, the 2002 Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team won the South Dakota 9B High School Football Championship with an 11-1 record by virtue of outstanding character, dedication to excellence, and perseverance on and off the field; and WHEREAS, the Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team received superior wisdom and superb leadership guidance from head coach Kelly Hansen and assistant coaches Mark Gemar, Don Ludens, and Jeff Kramer; and WHEREAS, the Joe Robbie MVP, Justin Horn, and fellow teammates Steven Hale, Mike Schelske, Brandon Grebner, Nathan Harrington, and Brett Maag were awarded Class 9B First- team All State Awards for their exceptional performances and dedication during the 2002 season: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team be recognized for their excellence in athletics and academics for the 2002-2003 school year.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring the 2002 Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team and the students and staff involved in the football program. WHEREAS, the 2002 Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team won the South Dakota 9B High School Football Championship with an 11-1 record by virtue of outstanding character, dedication to excellence, and perseverance on and off the field; and WHEREAS, the Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team received superior wisdom and superb leadership guidance from head coach Kelly Hansen and assistant coaches Mark Gemar, Don Ludens, and Jeff Kramer; and WHEREAS, the Joe Robbie MVP, Justin Horn, and fellow teammates Steven Hale, Mike Schelske, Brandon Grebner, Nathan Harrington, and Brett Maag were awarded Class 9B First-team All State Awards for their exceptional performances and dedication during the 2002 season: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-eighth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Tripp-Delmont Wildcats High School football team be recognized for their excellence in athletics and academics for the 2002-2003 school year.
